result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery Lee Hardnett Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 2:19 PM Defendant Jeffery Lee Hardnett Sr. in court.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Jeffery Lee Hardnett Sr.  Attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 1 and 2; Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders 60 days Rock County Jail with full huber, each count, concurrent with each other, 60 days sentence credit.
Court trial on October 26, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
